Detailed Description

A function class to calculate external capture integrals.

The ECIntegral function class calculates external capture integrals for both positive and negative energy channels. The results are returned as an ECIntResult structure.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ECIntegral::ECIntegral ( PPair *  pPair  )  [inline]

The ECIntegral object is created with reference to a PPair object. The PPair object is used to create new instances of the CoulFunc and WhitFunc objects.

ECIntegral::~ECIntegral (  )  [inline]

The CoulFunc and WhitFunc objects are destroyed with the object.

Member Function Documentation

double ECIntegral::ChanRad (  )  const [inline]

Returns the channel radius for the particle pair.

CoulFunc* ECIntegral::coulfunction (  )  const [inline]

Returns a pointer to the Coulomb function.

ECIntResult ECIntegral::operator() ( int  li,
int  lf,
int  multL,
double  inEnergy,
double  levelEnergy 
) const [inline]

Overloaded operator to make the class instance callable as a function. The intial and final orbital angular momentum, the gamma multipolarity, and the incoming energy and final state energy in the compound system are the dependent variables. The function returns an ECIntResult structure.

double ECIntegral::TotalSepE (  )  const [inline]

Returns the total seperation energy for the particle pair.

WhitFunc* ECIntegral::whitfunction (  )  const [inline]

Returns a pointer to the Whittaker function.
